column1: Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba!////I dined here for the first time on Thursday. I met my date around 7 pm
column2: and the restaurant was fairly busy then
column3: but quickly filled up around us. We started with a 1/2 pitcher of the classic red sangria
column5: but agreed it would be better as a refreshing summer drink. The tapas we ordered included the citrus-cured salmon
column7: the beef tenderloin with blue cheese
column8: and the goat cheese with tomato sauce. The last two are musts! For dessert
column9: we shared the dulce tres leche (listed as caramel on the menu)
column11: especially when paired with the Taylor 10 year I ordered.
